page.title: 07WEST CEMETERY IN DARLINGTON
page.content: West Cemetery covers 62 acres of land and it opened in 1857. In the Cemetery in 1972 a Roman tomb was discovered but unfortunately from which date is unknown. The Book of Remembrance is opened daily showing the names of people who died on each date. In the Cemetery Charles Dickens' brother was buried in 1868. Quite a few well-known people are buried there like the famous Pease family. There is a block where Jewish people are buried showing David's star. In 1942 most people died because of the second world war. There are different kinds of headstones some with pictures on like horses and cars, depending on the work of the deceased person. West Cemetery can be visited from Carmel Road North.
